articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: The falling-out began brewing days ago when Musk denounced Trump's tax-cut and spending bill.
articles.title: Trump is not interested in talking to Musk as they feud over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Thomas Peter, Anna Voitenko, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: The air force said Russia had used 407 drones, one of the largest numbers recorded in a single attack.
articles.title: Three killed, 49 wounded in intense Russian air attacks on Ukraine

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As Palestinians across the war-ravaged Gaza Strip marked the start of Eid al-Adha, Israeli forces continued military operations.
articles.title: Overcrowding forces halt to Gaza aid distribution, Eid holiday marked by violence

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The strikes dealt a powerful symbolic blow to a country that, throughout the Ukraine war, has frequently reminded the world of its nuclear might.
articles.title: Russia faces struggle to replace bombers lost in Ukrainian drone strikes

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Sources say $500 million will be given to the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation and would come from the USAID, which is being folded into the U.S. State Department.
articles.title: Exclusive: US mulls giving millions to controversial Gaza aid foundation, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man mistakenly deported from Maryland to El Salvador by the Trump administration, is on his way back to the U.S. to face criminal charges, ABC News reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Mistakenly deported man Abrego Garcia on way to US to face charges, ABC News reports

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: China has signalled for more than 15 years that it was looking to weaponise areas of the global supply chain, a strategy modelled on longstanding American export controls Beijing views as aimed at stalling its rise.
articles.title: China’s rare earth weapon changes contours of trade war battlefield

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: China is taking further steps towards high seas boarding of fishing boats in the Pacific for the first time, risking tensions with Taiwanese fleets and U.S. Coast Guard vessels that ply the region, Pacific Islands officials told Reuters.
articles.title: China demonstrates coast guard capability to Pacific nations, step towards high seas patrols

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia sees little chance of saving its last nuclear accord with the United States, due to expire in eight months, given the "ruined" state of relations with Washington, its top arms control official said in an interview published on Friday.
articles.title: Russia sees bleak prospects for expiring nuclear arms pact given 'ruined' ties with US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The earliest Boeing's Starliner spacecraft could fly again is early 2026, NASA said on Friday, as it evaluates whether to put humans on board one year after propulsion system issues on the capsule forced its debut crew to stay on the International Space Station for roughly nine months.
articles.title: NASA says no decision yet on whether next Boeing Starliner flight will carry crew
